poem:
### Portrait of an Oxford Don

In cloistered halls where whispers flit,  
Jeremy strolls, a ghost of wit,  
His velvet lectures weave a spell,  
Between the arches, knowledge swells.  
High tables echo gossip's flight,  
As history wraps in twilight's light.  
In ink and paper, he remains,  
A scholar's soul in learned veins.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "In brief: Jeremy Catto; Haunted Tales; A Ballet of Lepers – review Jeremy Catto: A Portrait of the Quintessential Oxford Don David Vaiani Unicorn, £25, pp208 Jeremy Catto, who died in 2018, was an Oxford don of the old school, the kind who Anthony Powell or Tom Sharpe might have created. In this affectionate and well-researched biography, a former student of his evokes not only a life of high table gossip and well-connected friendships that". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
